Title: Rational-function interpolation from p-adic evaluations in scattering amplitude calculations
Summary: This talk discusses new techniques using p-adic numbers for interpolating rational functions in multi-loop scattering amplitude calculations, achieving significant efficiency improvements.

Title: Ahead-of-time (AOT) compilation of Tensorflow models for deployment
Summary: The talk presents a novel inference approach using Ahead-of-time (AOT) compilation for TensorFlow models to reduce memory footprint and improve computational performance in CMS workflows.

Title: Generalized Parton Distribution Functions via Quantum Computing
Summary: This talk explores quantum simulation algorithms for quantum field theories, specifically focusing on generalized parton distribution functions for hadrons using a light-front formulation.

Title: Optimizing the ATLAS Geant4 detector simulation
Summary: The ATLAS experiment's Geant4 detector simulation improvements for Run 3, including Woodcock tracking and various optimizations, resulting in a significant increase in throughput.

Title: Is Quantum Computing energy efficient? An Investigation on a quantum annealer.
Summary: The study compares energy efficiency between classical HPC technologies and the D-Wave Advantage quantum annealer using benchmark activities.

Title: A fresh look at the nested soft-collinear subtraction scheme: NNLO QCD corrections to N-gluon final states in quark-anti-quark annihilation
Summary: Utilizes the nested soft-collinear subtraction scheme to compute NNLO QCD corrections for quark-anti-quark annihilation into multiple gluon jets, showcasing the cancellation of singularities.

Title: Fast and Precise Amplitude Surrogates with Bayesian and Symmetry Preserving Networks
Summary: A deep learning framework using permutation invariance and Lorentz equivariance to predict amplitudes from phase space points, incorporating Bayesian networks for uncertainty optimization.

Title: FASER Tracking and Emulsion Station Alignment
Summary: Presentation on the alignment of FASER's tracking and emulsion stations using 2022 collision data, including the tracking spectrometer and InterFace Tracker (IFT).

Title: "Accelerating Particle Physics Simulations with Machine Learning using Normalizing Flows and Flow Matching"
Summary: Using Normalizing Flows and Flow Matching to accelerate simulations of high-energy physics collision events, achieving faster and accurate predictions compared to traditional methods.

Title: Real-time error mitigation for variational optimization on quantum hardware
Summary: Real-time error mitigation for quantum variational models using Importance Clifford Sampling to manage noise in gradient-based optimization, with applications to training noisy quantum circuits.

Title: QUnfold: Quantum Annealing for Distributions Unfolding in High-Energy Physics
Summary: This work introduces QUnfold, a Python module for unfolding distorted distributions in HEP using quantum annealing, validated on simulated LHC data.

Title: quantum GAN for fast shower simulation
Summary: This study explores the use of quantum GANs for fast shower simulation in high-energy physics, focusing on downsampled calorimeter shower shapes and performance on quantum hardware.

Title: Quantum simulation with just-in-time compilation
Summary: Explores just-in-time compilation for quantum simulation on CPUs and GPUs, introducing the 	exttt{qibojit} module for the 	exttt{Qibo} framework, and benchmarking its performance.

Title: Towards an open-source hybrid quantum operating system
Summary: Presentation of Qibo, an open-source framework for quantum computing, including Qibolab and Qibocal libraries for executing and calibrating quantum hardware.

Title: Quantum-centric Supercomputing for Physics Research
Summary: The talk discusses the integration of quantum computational devices with high-performance computing resources to solve intractable problems in physics research.

Title: Advancing Image Classification using Intel SDK: Integrating NAQSS Encoding with Hybrid Quantum-Classical PQC Models
Summary: The work explores using Normal Arbitrary Quantum Superposition State (NAQSS) for encoding images into quantum circuits and improving classification accuracy with hybrid quantum-classical models.
Keywords: ['Quantum Computing', 'Image Classification', 'Quantum Machine Learning', 'Intel Quantum SDK']

Title: Modern Machine Learning Tools for Unfolding
Summary: Modern machine learning tools are used to perform high-dimensional, unbinned unfolding of LHC data with methods such as event reweighting and direct mapping, accounting for correlations.

Title: Implementation of zero trust security strategy in HEPS scientific computing system
Summary: Discusses designing a zero-trust security strategy for the HEPS scientific computing system to manage service permissions and improve cybersecurity.

Title: Using Legacy ATLAS C++ Calibration Tools in Modern Columnar Analysis Environments
Summary: Efforts to adapt legacy ATLAS C++ calibration tools for use in modern columnar analysis environments like Python/Awkward and RDataFrame.

Title: Design and Implementation of a Container-based Public Service Cloud Platform for HEPS
Summary: Study on developing a container-based cloud platform for High Energy Photon Source using Kubernetes to enhance resource utilization and system scalability, incorporating CICD for efficiency.

Title: Supervised job preemption methodology for controlled memory consumption of jobs running in the ALICE Grid
Summary: The paper discusses a methodology for controlled memory consumption in the ALICE Grid by implementing targeted job preemption to prevent overconsumption and promote job completion.

Title: Low Latency, High Bandwidth Streaming of Experimental Data with EJFAT
Summary: JLab and ESnet developed EJFAT, an FPGA-accelerated architecture for low latency, high throughput data streaming and dynamic load balancing.

Title: CLAS12 remote data-stream processing using ERSAP framework
Summary: The abstract discusses integrating the JLAB CLAS12 event reconstruction application within the ERSAP data-stream processing framework to improve data processing workflows and quality assurance.

Title: HEP Benchmark Suite: Enhancing Efficiency and Sustainability in Worldwide LHC Computing Infrastructures
Summary: This paper introduces the HEP Benchmark suite for measuring computing resource performance across WLCG sites, focusing on efficiency, power consumption, and anomaly detection.
Keywords: ['HEP Benchmark suite', 'WLCG', 'performance metrics', 'power consumption', 'compute resource utilization']

Title: A Function-As-Task Workflow Management Approach with PanDA and iDDS
Summary: Overview of the PanDA and iDDS platform for automating multi-step data processing workflows, focusing on python-based user interfaces and distributed task scheduling.

Title: JUNO raw data management system
Summary: Description of JUNO's raw data management system for distributed storage, data registration, replication, archiving, and reconstruction.

Title: CaloDiT: Diffusion with transformers for fast shower simulation
Summary: Combines diffusion models with transformer architecture for improved generalization in calorimeter shower simulations.

Title: Towards a Simplified (Fast) Simulation Infrastructure in ATLAS
Summary: The talk discusses the integration of FastCaloSimV2 into Geant4 to improve the simulation infrastructure of the ATLAS experiment, aiming to simplify and streamline the process.

Title: Effective denoising diffusion probabilistic models for fast and high fidelity whole-event simulation in high-energy heavy-ion experiment
Summary: Investigation of denoising diffusion probabilistic models (DDPM) for high-fidelity event simulation in high-energy heavy-ion experiments compared to GANs.

Title: Deep learning methods for noise filtering in the NA61/SHINE experiment.
Summary: The talk discusses using deep learning methods (DNN, CNN) for noise filtering in NA61/SHINE experiment's upgraded TPCs, highlighting model integration and performance metrics.

Title: First experiences with the LHCb heterogeneous software trigger
Summary: Overview of LHCb's software trigger using GPUs and CPUs, discussing online alignment, calibration, and real-time analysis challenges from 2022-2023.

Title: Phase-2  Upgrade of the ATLAS L1 Central Trigger
Summary: Overview of the upgraded ATLAS L1 Central Trigger system for Phase 2 LHC, including new custom electronics, firmware, and the introduction of delayed triggers.

Title: Fair Universe: HiggsML Uncertainty Challenge
Summary: The Fair Universe project is creating an AI ecosystem for HEP to minimize systematic uncertainties and predict confidence intervals using large datasets and advanced analysis techniques.

Title: The performance profiling of ptycho-W1Net AI algorithm on DCU and HUAWEI NPU 910
Summary: The presentation discusses the profiling and performance of the W1-Net AI algorithm implemented on DCU and HUAWEI NPU 910 clusters, highlighting improvements and challenges compared to Nvidia GPUs.

Title: Scaling the SciDAC QuantOM Workflow
Summary: The QuantOM project analyzes DIS data from Jefferson Lab and the Electron Ion Collider using ML algorithms on HPC systems to optimize theory-experiment fits.

Title: Monitoring the OSDF - Open Science Data Federation
Summary: The OSDF enhances data distribution with new origins, caches, access methods, and monitoring tools, forming a key part of U.S. cyberinfrastructure.

Title: AI-driven HPC Workflows Execution with Adaptivity and Asynchronicity in Mind
Summary: Investigation into adaptive and asynchronous execution of heterogeneous tasks in scientific workflows using AI-driven middleware for improved resource utilization and reduced costs.

Title: Study of columnar data analysis methods to complete an ATLAS analysis
Summary: Testing the applicability and user-friendliness of columnar data analysis tools, including ServiceX and Coffea, in completing a full Run-2 ATLAS analysis and discussing workflow adaptation challenges.

Title: Acceleration of the ML based fast simulation in high energy physics
Summary: Study on improving the speed and quality of ML-based fast event and detector simulation using diffusion models, focusing on efficient samplers, schedulers, and training techniques.

Title: Portable acceleration of CMS computing workflow with coprocessors as a service
Summary: Discusses using coprocessors to accelerate CMS data processing workflows, specifically offloading ML inference tasks to GPUs, with results from experiments at Google Cloud and Purdue Tier-2.

Title: Celeritas: evaluating performance of HEP detector simulation on GPUs
Summary: Celeritas is a Monte Carlo detector simulation library optimized for heterogeneous computing facilities, supporting CPUs and GPUs, and offering significant speedup for HL-LHC simulations.

Title: Performance of the Gaussino CaloChallenge-compatible infrastucture for ML-based fast simulation in the LHCb Experiment
Summary: Presentation of a new Gaussino component for integrating ML-based fast simulation in LHCb, supporting PyTorch and ONNXRuntime, and showcasing its application in CaloChallenge models and LHCb electromagnetic showers.

Title: columnflow: Fully automated analysis through flow of columns over arbitrary, distributed resources
Summary: Toolkit for columnar HEP analysis automating analysis workflows over distributed resources using Python and various libraries.

Title: Porting and optimizing the performance of LArTPC Detector Simulations with C++ standard parallelism
Summary: Explores the use of C++ standard parallelism for performance optimization in Liquid Argon Time Projection Chamber simulations within the HEP-CCE project.

Title: A Microbenchmark Framework for Performance Evaluation of OpenMP Target Offloading
Summary: Framework using Catch2 for evaluating OpenMP target offloading performance via micro-benchmarks on supercomputers like Perlmutter and Frontier.

Title: Easy columnar file conversions with "odapt"
Summary: A Python package 'odapt' simplifies the conversion of columnar data file formats, offers automatic memory management, compression, and supports merging and editing ROOT files using h5py, Uproot, Awkward, and dask-awkward.

Title: HPC, HTC and Cloud: converging toward a seamless computing federation with interLink
Summary: The interLink project integrates HPC, HTC, and Cloud computing for Digital Twin applications using Kubernetes APIs to enable transparent offloading across heterogeneous providers.

Title: RTDP: Streaming Readout Real-Time Development and Testing Platform
Summary: JLab is developing the RTDP for streaming readout systems, integrating AI/ML, HTC, and heterogeneous computing to facilitate data processing and analysis.

Title: Hydra: Computer Vision for Data Quality Monitoring
Summary: Hydra is a framework for training and deploying machine learning models for near real-time data quality monitoring, featuring web interfaces for dataset labeling and interpretability via gradCAM.

Title: Scalable GNN Training for Track Finding
Summary: Graph Neural Networks are explored for particle track-finding in HEP, focusing on scalable training using distributed data parallelism on multi-GPUs and reporting preliminary results with TrackML dataset.

Title: Awkward Family: expanding functionality through interrelated Python packages
Summary: The talk discusses leveraging Python's packaging infrastructures to separate stable from experimental components in Uproot and Awkward Array, and introduces new related packages.

Title: Optimal XCache deployment for the CMS experiment in Spain
Summary: Study on optimizing data cache solutions for CMS experiment in Spain to enhance remote data access and resource utilization using CDN techniques.

Title: Paving the Way for HPC: An XRootD-Based Approach for Efficiency and Workflow Optimizations for HEP Jobs on HPC Centers
Summary: Discusses the challenges and solutions for optimizing HEP workflows on HPC centers using an XRootD/XCache-based approach.

Title: Optimizing Resource Provisioning Across Diverse Computing Facilities with Virtual Kubelet Integration
Summary: The talk discusses optimizing resource provisioning across diverse computing facilities using Virtual Kubelet within the Kubernetes framework for improved flexibility and resource utilization.

Title: The Good, The Bad, and the Ugly: A Tale of Physics, Software, and ML
Summary: Modernization of a neural network to discriminate long lived particles from background at the LHC's ATLAS experiment using advanced software techniques.

Title: Lamarr: implementing a flash-simulation paradigm at LHCb
Summary: Lamarr is a new framework at LHCb using parametric functions and deep generative models to reduce computational cost in detector simulation by two orders of magnitude.
Keywords: ['fast simulation', 'machine learning', 'deep generative models', 'detector response', 'computational cost']

Title: Retrieval Augmented Generation for Particle Physics: A Case Study with the Snowmass White Papers and Reports
Summary: Explores using LLMs and Retrieval Augmented Generation to query and access information from the Snowmass reports corpus.

Title: ServiceX, the novel data delivery system, for physics analysis
Summary: ServiceX leverages modern software for effective data extraction and delivery, crucial for High-Luminosity LHC. It uses Kubernetes and a new python client library with REST API for physics analysis.

Title: LHC beam monitoring via real-time hit reconstruction in the LHCb VELO pixel detector
Summary: Real-time hit reconstruction in the LHCb VELO pixel detector via cluster-finding embedded in readout board firmware, enabling precision monitoring and diagnostics of LHC beam conditions.
Keywords: ['real-time processing', 'hit reconstruction', 'VELO pixel detector', 'DAQ bandwidth', 'HLT computing resources', 'beam monitoring', 'luminosity measurement']

Title: Declarative paradigms for analysis description and implementation
Summary: The talk discusses the adoption of declarative paradigms for analysis description to enhance processing speed, portability, and preservation in HEP experiments.

Title: Quasi interactive analysis of High Energy Physics big data with high throughput
Summary: This talk discusses porting multiple HEP data analysis applications to an interactive high-throughput platform using ROOT RDataFrame and distributed computing technologies like Jupyter, Dask, and HTCondor.

Title: Preservation of the Direct Photons and Neutral Pions Analysis in the PHENIX Experiment at RHIC
Summary: The PHENIX Collaboration discusses their Data and Analysis Preservation program, focusing on a complex analysis of direct photons and neutral pions in d+Au collisions using REANA.

Title: AdaptivePerf: a portable, low-overhead, and comprehensive code profiler for single- and multi-threaded applications
Summary: AdaptivePerf is an open-source, low-overhead profiling tool for analyzing single- and multi-threaded applications, improving on Linux perf by offering extensive and user-friendly profiling features.

Title: Generative Modeling for Fast Shower Simulation
Summary: This work presents deep generative models for simulating calorimeter shower events using various neural network architectures and distributed computing strategies.
Keywords: ['deep generative models', 'calorimeter shower simulation', 'neural networks', 'distributed computing']

Title: Enabling Computing Resources to Support Grid Jobs and Cluster Jobs Simultaneously
Summary: IHEP's computing platform integrates grid and local cluster resources to handle international and local experiment jobs using container technology and dynamic scheduling.
Experiment: ATLAS, CMS, LHCb, BELLEII, JUNO, BES, LHAASO

Title: The Workflow Management System for Data Processing towards Photon Sources
Summary: This project designs a graphical management system for data processing in photon source experiments, addressing high-throughput data and flexible experimental methodologies.

Title: Deployment of ATLAS Calorimeter Fast Simulation Training Through Container Technology
Summary: This work introduces FastCaloGANtainer, a containerized version of a fast simulation tool for the ATLAS calorimeter, aimed at reducing computational demands by using ML techniques and HPC clusters.

Title: The ATLAS Web Run Control system
Summary: The ATLAS Web Run Control system (WebRC) provides a web-based interface for monitoring and controlling ATLAS data taking, replacing the previous Igui system.

Title: Energy consumption characterization of Subnuclear Physics computing workloads
Summary: This work characterizes the energy consumption of subnuclear physics computing workloads and offers insights for reducing their environmental footprint.

Title: Offline data processing in the First JUNO Data Challenge
Summary: This presentation discusses the offline data processing for the first Jiangmen Underground Neutrino Observatory (JUNO) Data Challenge, including data quality monitoring, reconstruction, and conditions database testing.

Title: Boosting CPU Efficiency in ATLAS Inner Detector Reconstruction with Track Overlay
Summary: Enhancing CPU efficiency in ATLAS inner detector reconstruction using track overlay and ML-based decision processes to manage pileup and hard-scatter tracks.

Title: Describe Data to get Science-Data-Ready Tooling: Awkward as a Target for Kaitai Struct YAML
Summary: The talk introduces the Awkward Target for Kaitai Struct Compiler and demonstrates converting custom data formats to Awkward Arrays using the Kaitai Struct Awkward Runtime API.

Title: AtlFast3: Fast Simulation in ATLAS for LHC Run 3 and beyond
Summary: The talk discusses the improved AtlFast3 tool for fast simulation in ATLAS, utilizing parametric and machine learning methods to enhance MC event simulation for LHC Run 3.

Title: FATRAS integration for ATLAS fast simulation at HL-LHC
Summary: Integration of FATRAS for fast simulation in ATLAS, focusing on improved modeling, efficiency, and multithread-compatibility for HL-LHC.

Title: Athena MPI: A Multi-Node Version of ATLAS's Athena Framework, Using Message Passing Interface
Summary: This presentation discusses enabling ATLAS's Athena framework to run over multiple nodes using MPI, aiming to handle the increased data from the High Luminosity LHC.

Title: interTwin - an Interdisciplinary Digital Twin Engine for Science
Summary: The interTwin project leverages Digital Twins for event generation at CERN and environmental modeling, using AI and distributed computing tools.

Title: Interface to Unity for High Energy Physics detector visualization
Summary: The work discusses an automated interface to convert HEP detector descriptions to 3D models in Unity for enhanced visualization.

Title: Web based HXMT data analysis platform
Summary: The report discusses an interactive web-based data analysis platform for HXMT satellite data using HXMTDAS, containers, virtualisation technology, and JupyterLab.

Title: Visualizing BESIII Events with Unity
Summary: Uses Unity for 3D modeling and animation to visualize BESIII detector events, aiding in analysis, interdisciplinary applications, and education.

Title: Introduction of dynamic job matching optimization for Grid middleware using Site Sonar infrastructure monitoring
Summary: A new approach for dynamically adding and modifying job matching parameters in Grid middleware using Site Sonar monitoring to enhance flexibility and reduce risks.

Title: The MadNIS Reloaded
Summary: Combines machine-learned multi-channel weights and normalizing flows for improved numerical integration and event generation for LHC predictions, validated on processes like VBS and W+jets.

Title: Two-loop five-points QCD amplitudes in full colour
Summary: The talk covers recent advancements in calculating five-point scattering amplitudes in massless QCD beyond the leading-colour approximation, addressing the algebraic complexity of these calculations.

Title: 3-loop Feynman integrals in the Euclidean or physical kinematical region
Summary: This work addresses methods for 3-loop two-point Feynman integrals with up to 6 internal lines using numerical extrapolation and adaptive iterated integration.

Title: Real-time track reconstruction with FPGAs in the LHCb Scintillating Fibre Tracker beyond Run 3
Summary: LHCb is developing a real-time tracking device using FPGAs to enhance track reconstruction in the Scintillating Fibre Tracker for future LHC runs.

Title: ATLAS TDAQ Phase-2
Summary: The ATLAS experiment's TDAQ system is being upgraded for the High Luminosity LHC to handle increased data rates and pileup, utilizing commodity hardware, FPGAs, and commercial accelerators.

Title: Pinpoint resource allocation for GPU batch applications
Summary: Explores efficient resource allocation for GPU batch applications in HEP, focusing on Nvidia's MPS and KIT HTCondor batch system to improve throughput and energy efficiency.

Title: Fully containerised approach for the HPC cluster at FAIR
Summary: Operational approach for HPC cluster at GSI/FAIR using containerization for diverse workflows and user applications.

Title: ACTS as a Service
Summary: This talk covers deploying GNN-based track-finding algorithms as a service using Nvidia Triton Inference Server within ACTS for HL-LHC, focusing on computational challenges and scalability.

Title: Key4hep
Summary: The Key4hep software stack provides tools for full simulation studies of future Higgs factory detectors, including tracking, particle flow clustering, and converting results for machine learning tools.

Title: Bridging Worlds: Achieving Language Interoperability between Julia and Python in Scientific Computing
Summary: Explores interoperability between Julia and Python in HEP data analysis using Awkward Array data structures, focusing on memory management, data buffer copies, and performance enhancements.

Title: A Mechanism for Asynchronous Offloading in the Multithreaded Gaudi Event Processing Framework
Summary: Explores a prototype for the Gaudi framework to asynchronously offload GPU-accelerated algorithms, improving CPU and GPU efficiency.

Title: Optimizing the CMS Offline Software Infrastrucure for Run 3
Summary: This work details recent enhancements in the CMSSW framework, focusing on compiler techniques, heterogeneous resources, and the improvement of the CMS Continuous Integration infrastructure.

Title: Evaluating Application Characteristics for GPU Portability Layer Selection
Summary: Study on application and kernel characteristics influencing GPU portability layer selection for HPCs and their performance on various HEP tasks.

Title: New developments and applications of a Deep-learning-based Full Event Interpretation (DFEI) in proton-proton collisions
Summary: The talk discusses a novel approach using Deep-learning based Full Event Interpretation for heavy-hadron decays at LHCb, leveraging Graph Neural Networks to improve data analysis and background suppression.
Keywords: ['Deep Learning', 'Graph Neural Networks', 'Heavy-Hadron Decays', 'Background Suppression', 'Data Analysis']

Title: Improving Computational Performance of a GNN Track Reconstruction Pipeline for ATLAS
Summary: Deep learning techniques improve track reconstruction in ATLAS for HL-LHC by optimizing computational performance through various methods like pruning, knowledge distillation, and GPU-optimized segmentation.

Title: Accelerating Machine Learning Inference on GPUs with SYCL using SOFIE
Summary: Presentation on SOFIE, a tool from CERN's ROOT project, that generates SYCL code for GPU-accelerated machine learning inference with significant speedups.

Title: Optimizing ANN-Based Triggering for BSM events with Knowledge Distillation
Summary: This work explores using Knowledge Distillation to optimize ANN-based triggers for BSM events, focusing on FPGA implementation and performance trade-offs.

Title: HPC Friendly HEP data model and RNTuple in HEP-CCE
Summary: The talk discusses HPC-friendly storage formats and data models for HEP experiments, focusing on HEP-CCE's work with HDF5 and ROOT::RNTuple for efficient I/O and processing on GPUs.

Title: Seamless transition from TTree to RNTuple analysis with RDataFrame
Summary: The talk discusses the integration of RNTuple with RDataFrame, ensuring seamless analysis flow and improved performance, including distributed execution and multi-core processing.

Title: RNTupleInspector: A storage information utility for RNTuple
Summary: RNTupleInspector is a utility for understanding and monitoring storage patterns in RNTuple, ROOT's new I/O subsystem, aiding integration with existing software frameworks.

Title: Persistifying the complex Event Data Model of the ATLAS Experiment in RNTuple
Summary: Discussion on transitioning ATLAS Event Data Model from ROOT TTree to RNTuple for improved performance and future-proofing.

Title: dilax: Differentiable Binned Likelihoods in JAX
Summary: dilax is a software package for statistical inference using binned data, built on JAX for performance, differentiability, and object-oriented statistical model building.

Title: The SciDAC QuantOM Framework: A Composable Workflow
Summary: The QuantOM project analyzes DIS data using a composable workflow with deep learning for optimization, focusing on efficient multi-condition analysis.

Title: AI-based Data Popularity, Placement Optimization for a Novel Multi-tiered Storage System at BNL/SDCC Facility
Summary: The talk discusses optimizing data placement in a multi-tiered storage system using AI/ML techniques to predict data popularity and automate data migration.

Title: Implementing an emissions model for dual phase xenon TPCs with probabilistic programming
Summary: The talk discusses implementing emissions models for particle interactions in liquid xenon in a probabilistic programming framework, addressing challenges and applications like energy reconstruction.

Title: From Amsterdam to ACAT 2024: The Evolution and Convergence of Declarative Analysis Language Tools and Imperative Analysis Tools
Summary: Review of the development and convergence of Declarative Analysis Languages (DALs) in high-energy physics, focusing on their features, challenges, and future directions.

Title: Consistent multi-differential histogramming and summary statistics with YODA2
Summary: The YODA statistical library has been redesigned to enhance multi-dimensional histogramming and summary statistics, using C++ metaprogramming for collider physics data-model comparison.

Title: Common Analysis Tools in CMS
Summary: Discussion on the CMS Common Analysis Tools group, its structure, services, and recent developments in data processing frameworks, workflow management, and result interpretation.

Title: Deep Learning-Based C14 Pile-Up Identification in the JUNO Experiment
Summary: This talk discusses the use of deep learning models to identify C14 pile-up events in the JUNO experiment, crucial for determining neutrino mass ordering.

Title: Offline filter of data with abnormal high voltage at BESIII drift chamber
Summary: An offline filter algorithm was developed to remove events with abnormal high voltages in the BESIII drift chamber, ensuring stable operation and accurate dE/dx measurement.

Title: An empirical performance-portability evaluation for Lorentz Vectors computations via SYCL
Summary: Evaluation of SYCL-based GenVectorX for multi-platform Lorentz vectors computations in HEP, comparing performance with CUDA on NVIDIA GPUs.

Title: To be or not to be Equivariant?
Summary: Study on the performance of Lorentz-equivariant architectures in particle physics by breaking and comparing equivariance effects.

Title: Fast and Robust ML for uncovering BSM physics
Summary: Explores breakthroughs in ML for BSM discovery at LHC, using knowledge distillation and robust multi-background representation learning for out-of-distribution BSM signatures.

Title: The Neural Network First-Level Hardware Track Trigger of the Belle II Experiment
Summary: Describes the L1 hardware track trigger of Belle II using neural networks to estimate z-vertex and polar angles, enhancing event detection and background suppression.

Title: Generic representations of jets at detector-level with self-supervised learning
Summary: Explores self-supervised learning to create a generic jet feature representation, fine-tunable for tasks like kinematics prediction and classification, using a realistic calorimeter simulation.

Title: Machine learning-based particle identification of atmospheric neutrinos in JUNO
Summary: A machine learning approach for particle identification of atmospheric neutrinos in the JUNO liquid-scintillator detector, using PMT waveform features and neutron capture data.

Title: Boosting statistical anomaly detection via multiple test with NPLM
Summary: This presentation discusses enhancing statistical anomaly detection using multiple tests with the NPLM algorithm, focusing on kernel methods and AI-based techniques for signal-agnostic anomaly detection.

Title: Reducing Systematic Differences between Data and Simulation with Generative Models
Summary: Research on using GANs to reduce systematic differences between simulated and real data, focusing on LArTPC-based particle detectors.

Title: A Deep Generative Model for Hadronization
Summary: This work proposes the use of deep generative models, specifically GANs, to emulate and improve hadronization processes in high-energy physics simulations.

Title: Denoising Graph Super-Resolution with Diffusion Models and Transformers for Improved Particle Reconstruction
Summary: The presentation explores a transformer-based de-noising diffusion model for graph super-resolution to enhance calorimeter data resolution and improve particle reconstruction.

Title: Beyond Language: Foundation Models for Collider Physics Data
Summary: Explores the application of foundation models to collider physics data, addressing challenges like continuous and discrete data types, and permutation invariance.

Title: Finetuning Foundation Models for Joint Analysis Optimization
Summary: This study shows improved performance and data efficiency by integrating HEP analysis with machine learning workflows like pretraining and finetuning, exemplified by heavy resonance searches.

Title: Leveraging Language Models for Particle Reconstruction
Summary: This talk explores using language models to tokenize detector readout signals for enhanced particle reconstruction, demonstrating preliminary results in particle tracking.

Title: Towards the construction of Foundational Models at the LHC
Summary: Pre-training models on quark and gluon jets to improve tagging performance and reduce uncertainties for new physics searches at the LHC.

Title: Track reconstruction for future colliders with quantum algorithms
Summary: Explores the application of quantum algorithms, specifically the Quantum Approximate Optimization Algorithm (QAOA), for track reconstruction in future colliders like HL-LHC.

Title: Reconstructing Particle Tracks in One Go with a Recursive Graph Attention Network
Summary: Explores a recursive Graph Attention Network for particle track reconstruction that simplifies current multi-step GNN methods by using a one-shot object condensation approach.

Title: Reconstruction of atmospheric neutrinos and muons using Machine Learning-based methods in JUNO
Summary: The abstract discusses a novel multi-purpose reconstruction method for atmospheric neutrinos and muons in JUNO using PMT waveform analysis and machine learning techniques.

Title: Wire-Cell: A High Quality Automated LArTPC Reconstruction for Neutrino Experiments
Summary: Development and validation of Wire-Cell, a high-quality automated 3D reconstruction framework for LArTPC detectors in neutrino experiments.

Title: Tracking and vertexing downstream the LHCb magnet at the first stage of the trigger.
Summary: The "Downstream" algorithm at LHCb reconstructs very displaced vertices in real time using GPUs and a Neural Network, enhancing the detection of long-lived particles in Run3.

Title: High Pileup Particle Tracking with Learned Clustering
Summary: This talk discusses using learned clustering for particle tracking in high-pileup experiments, presenting results on the trackML dataset and improvements in inference speeds.

Title: Leveraging Large-Scale Pretraining for Efficient Jet Classification: An Evaluation of Transfer Learning, Model Architectures, Dataset Scaling, and Domain Adaptation in Particle Physics
Summary: This study employs self-supervised learning to use unlabeled real data for effective jet classification, exploring dataset scalability, contrastive learning techniques, and domain adaptation.

Title: Line Segment Tracking: Improving the Phase 2 CMS High Level Trigger Tracking with a Novel, Hardware-Agnostic Pattern Recognition Algorithm
Summary: A novel, hardware-agnostic, parallelizable pattern recognition algorithm for charged particle reconstruction in the CMS High Level Trigger using the Alpaka library.

Title: Application of ACTS for gaseous tracking detectors
Summary: The talk discusses the extension of the ACTS software to support gaseous tracking detectors, including applications to CEPC and STCF, and efforts to add an open-access drift chamber to the Open Data Detector.

Title: Machine learning based surrogates for particle-resolved direct numerical simulation
Summary: This study improves PR-DNS models for aerosol-cloud-turbulence interactions using Fourier Neural Operators for faster, accurate surrogates in velocity and vorticity fields.
Keywords: ['Machine Learning', 'High Performance Computing', 'Atmospheric Physics', 'Direct Numerical Simulation']

Title: Precision-Machine Learning for the Matrix Element Method
Summary: A machine learning framework for the matrix element method using INN, diffusion networks, and a transformer for jet combinatorics, demonstrated on the CP-phase of the top Yukawa coupling.
Keywords: ['Machine Learning', 'Matrix Element Method', 'Bayesian Networks', 'Jet Combinatorics', 'Top Yukawa Coupling']

Title: Pepper  A Portable Parton-Level Event Generator for the High-Luminosity LHC
Summary: A new leading-order parton-level event generation framework for the High-Luminosity LHC, optimized for modern hardware to ensure sustainable simulations.

Title: Efficient precision simulation of processes with many-jet final states at the LHC
Summary: Flexible and efficient simulation approach for collider events with multi-jet final states, validated with processes like Higgs plus multi-jet production using Sherpa and Pythia.

Title: Towards a framework for GPU event generation
Summary: The presentation discusses the PDFFlow-VegasFlow-MadFlow suite, highlighting the advantages of hardware-agnostic Monte Carlo event generation and GPU performance improvements.

Title: McMule -- a Monte Carlo generator for low energy processes
Summary: McMule is a Monte Carlo generator for low-energy QED processes at NNLO, suitable for predicting outcomes in experiments like MUonE, CMD-III, PRad, and MUSE, and it now includes event generation with cellular resampling.

Title: Total 10-th order QED electon anomalous magnetic moment calculation
Summary: Presentation of total 5-loop QED calculation results for the electron anomalous magnetic moment, including a comparison with previous values and a new method for reduction to finite integrals.

Title: Multiscale Lattice Gauge Theory Algorithms and Software for Exascale hardware.
Summary: Development of performance portable software and multiscale algorithms for GPU architectures to calculate the hadronic vacuum polarisation contribution to the muon's magnetic moment.
Keywords: ['Lattice Gauge Theory', 'GPU architectures', 'Multigrid algorithms', 'Hadronic vacuum polarisation']
